sentences.sContent: Smacking is not an acceptable way of punishing a child.
sentences.sCn: 要惩罚孩子，不应该用打的方式。

sentences.sContent: He promised to punish severely any officials found guilty of electoral fraud.
sentences.sCn: 他承诺要严惩任何在选举中有欺诈行为的官员。

sentences.sContent: They deserve to be punished for putting passengers at risk.
sentences.sCn: 他们置乘客于危险之中，理应受到惩罚。

sentences.sContent: I felt I was being punished for what my mother had done.
sentences.sCn: 我觉得自己在为妈妈的所作所为接受惩罚。

synos.tran: 惩罚；严厉对待；贪婪地吃喝

words.tran: 严厉的；打击沉重的；精疲力尽的

trans.tranCn: 惩罚；严厉对待；贪婪地吃喝
trans.tranOther: to make someone suffer because they have done something wrong or broken the law
